title: 108_hr5378
content: The "Community Restoration and Revitalization Act of 2004" may modify rules for determining the applicable percentage for certain buildings eligible for low-income housing credit. The "Community Restoration and Revitalization Act of 2004" modifies the applicable percentage for low-income housing credit for specific buildings. The changes include adjustments to the qualified basis of buildings for rehabilitation credit. The amendments made by the "Community Restoration and Revitalization Act of 2004" apply to housing credit dollar amounts allocated after December 31, 2003, and buildings placed in service after that date, with respect to bonds issued after the same date. SEC. 3. Modification to basis adjustment rule, amending the Internal Revenue Code to include rehabilitation credit. Effective date is for taxable years after December 31, 2003. SEC. 4. Increase in rehabilitation credit for certain smaller projects. Section 47 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a special rule for smaller rehabilitation projects. For qualified buildings under $1,000,000, the rehabilitation credit is increased to 40 percent, and for expenditures over $1,000,000, it remains at 20 percent. The term 'smaller project' refers to a qualified rehabilitated building with rehabilitation expenditures not exceeding $2,000,000. No credit was allowed in the previous two years, except for buildings with a specific election made. Coordination with subsection (d) is required. The amendment specifies that a building will be considered a smaller project if the rehabilitation expenditures do not exceed $2,000,000 and a specific election is made. This amendment applies to property placed in service after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 5 amends the Internal Revenue Code to replace "certified historic structure" with "qualified rehabilitated building" for the investment credit. The amendment applies to property placed in service after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 6 specifies the date by which a building must be first placed in service. SEC. 6 amends the Internal Revenue Code to specify the date by which a building must be first placed in service, no less than 50 years prior to the year of qualified rehabilitation expenditures. SEC. 7 amends the tax-exempt use property clause in the Internal Revenue Code by increasing the percentage from 35% to 50%. The effective date for these amendments is for property placed in service after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 8 increases the rehabilitation credit for buildings in high-cost areas. SEC. 8 amends the definition of qualified rehabilitation expenditures in the Internal Revenue Code by increasing the credit for buildings in high-cost areas to 130 percent for qualified rehabilitated buildings in designated areas. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act, with rules similar to section 42(d)(5)(C) being applied.
